summary: This document is a forwarded email chain from July 2021, primarily featuring communications from Richard C. Curtiss to various news organizations and government officials. Curtiss attempts to report on alleged corruption in the courts and government, and specifically offers information about being inside the SHU at the Metropolitan Correctional Center where Jeffrey Epstein died, questioning the circumstances of his death. The chain includes responses from news editors declining the story and administrative responses from courts and agencies.

persons.name: Richard C. Curtiss
persons.context: Individual emailing news organizations and government officials alleging court corruption and offering insider information about the Metropolitan Correctional Center and Jeffrey Epstein's death.

persons.name: Jim W. Dean
persons.context: News editor who responds to Curtiss, stating his topic is too narrow and 'a local news story'.

persons.name: Randolph T.
persons.role: Customer Care Advocate at The New York Times
persons.context: New York Times customer service representative responding to a forwarded support request.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure in the case; his death by hanging (ruled suicide) in the Metropolitan Correctional Center is discussed, with Curtiss questioning the circumstances.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of possibly holding 'toxic' information for a plea negotiation.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.role: US Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Mentioned as having sent a Civilian Crime Report to Curtiss.

persons.name: David Schoen
persons.context: Attorney who reportedly met with Epstein in jail and expressed belief that Epstein did not commit suicide, citing threats.

persons.name: Barbara Sampson
persons.context: Ruled Epstein's death a suicide by hanging; Curtiss emails her office asking for drug test results.

persons.name: Adam Schiff
persons.context: One of the recipients of an email from Curtiss alleging government employee union corruption and crimes against him.

persons.name: Nancy Pelosi
persons.context: One of the recipients of an email from Curtiss alleging government employee union corruption and crimes against him.

persons.name: Jerrold Nadler
persons.context: One of the recipients of an email from Curtiss alleging government employee union corruption and crimes against him.

persons.name: Chuck Schumer
persons.context: Copied on an email from Curtiss to House officials.

persons.name: Keith Castaldo
persons.context: Copied on an email from Curtiss to House officials.

persons.name: Mike Pence
persons.context: Mentioned in a news excerpt about the firing of FBI Director James Comey.

persons.name: James Comey
persons.context: Mentioned in a news excerpt about his firing not being over the Russia investigation.

persons.name: Alexander Vindman
persons.role: Lt. Col., source of Ukraine Investigation
persons.context: Mentioned in a passage as the 'original source' of the Ukraine Investigation.

connections.description: Maxwell is referenced as possibly holding a 'final stash' of information to negotiate a plea, indicating a close and conspiratorial association.
Schoen met with Epstein in jail to discuss taking over his defense team, indicating an attorney-client relationship was being established.
Curtiss repeatedly emails Dean, a news editor, attempting to pitch stories about court corruption and Epstein's death.
Curtiss received a Civilian Crime Report from US Attorney Strauss.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died by hanging (ruled a suicide) in the SHU of the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York City.

events.title: Curtiss offers insider information on Epstein death
events.description: Richard Curtiss emails news editor Jim Dean claiming he was inside the SHU where Epstein died and offers information on guard procedures and camera malfunctions.

events.title: Medical examiner rules Epstein death a suicide
events.description: Chief Medical Examiner Dr. Barbara Sampson issues a statement ruling Epstein's death a suicide by hanging after review.

events.title: News editor declines story on court corruption
events.description: Editor Jim Dean responds to Curtiss, stating allegations of court corruption are 'a local news story' and too narrow for Thomson Reuters.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York City, NY
8393 Pardee Hollow Road, Wayland, New York 14572
Office of the Chief Medical Examiner, 520 1st Avenue, New York, NY 10016
Federal Bureau of Prisons, 320 First Street, N.W., Washington, D.C. 20534
keyFacts: Richard C. Curtiss claims to have been inside the Special Housing Unit (SHU) of the Metropolitan Correctional Center where Jeffrey Epstein died and questions why guards turned cameras off and failed to perform 30-minute checks.
An email suggests Ghislaine Maxwell may be holding a 'final stash' of highly toxic information for plea negotiations, which prosecutors' employers would avoid.
Attorney David Schoen reportedly met with Epstein the day he died to discuss taking over his defense and expressed belief it was not a suicide, citing threats Epstein relayed to him.
The document includes administrative rejections from courts and news organizations to Curtiss's attempts to report on alleged corruption and Epstein's death.
The NYC Chief Medical Examiner's office confirmed Epstein's death was ruled a suicide by hanging and declined to specify if drug tests were performed.
